page.title: 16Panshanger Aerodrome.
page.content: Panshanger Aerodrome is used as a flying school and a private airstrip. 0ne lesson costs fifty six pounds an hour.The planes owned by the flying school are used for about five hours a day.In one year there are 1300 trips. Most trips are local or European.The hangars are used for storage.The aerodrome was owned by De Havilland until the second world war.It was then taken over by the R.A.F and was used as a decoy and training base until 1953.Then it was bought by Mr Summers of the London Aero Club.Then it became used by private aircraft.It was illegally used to bring in immigrants. In the last three and a half years there have been only 2 accidents and nobody was hurt in either.
